In Python, I am trying to declare a long string that spans multiple lines. Here is the code I currently have:

```python
long_string = '
this is a really
really
really
long
string
'
```

However, it seems that Python is not recognizing this as a valid string due to its multi-line nature. How can I properly declare a multi-line string in Python?

To declare a multi-line string in Python, you can use triple quotes, either single (`'''`) or double (`"""`) quotes. This allows you to span the string across multiple lines without any issues. Here's how you can modify your code to properly declare a multi-line string:

```python
long_string = '''
this is a really
really
really
long
string
'''

# Or using double quotes:

long_string = """
this is a really
really
really
long
string
"""
```

Both methods will correctly create a multi-line string in Python. You can choose either single or double triple quotes based on your preference or any other constraints you may have with your code.
